body_content.explanation: a method of cleaning up pollution from oil, poisons, waste, etc. using bacteria or other small organisms that break down the substance :
examples: Bioremediation has been used in high-profile cleanups, including oil spilled from the well fires off the coast of Kuwait after the 1991 Persian Gulf War.
Researchers devised a bioremediation system that electrically stimulates bacteria to break down toxic chemicals in the environment.
